node.title: Aussie skiers claim historic 1-2 in aerials World Cup
node.alt: Danielle Scott and Laura Peel smile and stand next to each other in the snow
node.description: Australia's Beijing 2022 Winter Olympic preparation ramps up with a historic 1-2 aerials finish and a silver medal for Belle Brockhoff in the snowboard cross.
node.content:
["Australia's preparations for the upcoming Winter Olympics have taken another giant leap forward, with Australian Aerial skiers recording a historic 1-2 at the FIS World Cup event in Ruka, Finland.\u00a0", "Danielle Scott and Laura Peel took home gold and silver after producing stunning one-off leaps to claim both spots on the top of the podium, beating China's Mengtao Xu into third.\u00a0", "Scott's\u00a0double full-full jump, triple twisting double back somersault\u00a0scored her a whopping 102.93 points to hand the 31-year-old a fifth World Cup victory.", "\"Walking away with the gold today feels pretty amazing,\" Scott told the Olympic Winter Institute of Australia after collecting her gold.", "\"It's been a bit of a slow, but good build to the season.", "\"I started doing triple back somersaults last week, but decided to compete double somersaults today.", "\"I have cracked the 100 point mark before on a triple twisting double, so I thought that would be my goal for today and ended up walking away with the win, which I am so incredibly happy with.\"", "", "
Danielle Scott claimed her fifth FIS\u00a0World Cup victory.(Supplied: OWIA)
", "Joining her on the podium was 2021 world champion and World Cup winner Peel, whose full-tuck-full double twisting triple back somersault earned her 99.37 points.", "It was the first double podium\u00a0finish in a World Cup event for Australia since Lydia Lasila and Peel won silver and bronze medals\u00a0at Lake Placid in 2018.", "Scott, who spent \"lots of hours\" at the Geoff Henke Olympic Winter Training Centre water jump in Brisbane, said it was great to share the podium with her teammate.", "The result comes hot on the heels of Australia's Bell Brockhoff securing silver in the snowboard cross event in Montafon, Austria.", "", "
Bell Brockhoff is now third on the World Cup rankings.(Supplied:\u00a0GEPA)
", "The 28-year-old moved to third in the overall World Cup standings after recording the 13th World Cup medal of her career.", "It's not just on the snow that Australia's preparations are picking up pace.", "On\u00a0Thursday night,\u00a0Dean Hewitt and Tahli Gill qualified\u00a0for the curling mixed doubles, the first time Australia will compete at a Game in curling.", "The Beijing Olympic Games gets underway on February 2, with the aerials competition starting on\u00a0February 13."]
